intro: Arracacia equatorialis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian arracacha, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system consists of thick, cylindrical roots that are used in traditional medicine and as a vegetable. Arracacia equatorialis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas.
